content: What causes the red color in Mars' soil?

The red color of Mars' soil is primarily due to the presence of iron oxide, commonly known as rust. Mars has a lot of iron-rich minerals in its soil, and over billions of years, these minerals have oxidized, or rusted, when exposed to the small amount of water and oxygen present on the planet. This process has given Mars its distinctive reddish appearance, earning it the nickname "the Red Planet."
